posts.post_content:
Ahem.  
  
[Spellskite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spellskite).  
  
That is all.  
  
@adrian.malacoda: Depends on the order that you redirect the spell/ability and activate Pemmin's Aura. You activate Pemmin's Aura giving Spellskite shroud, then on the stack you redirect the spell/ability to Spellskite. Spellskite's ability resolves first and redirects the spell/ability, then Pemmin's Aura's ability resolves and gives Spellskite shroud, then the spell/ability tries to resolve but can't, and the spell/ability fizzles.
posts.html:
Ahem.

Spellskite.

That is all.

@adrian.malacoda: Depends on the order that you redirect the spell/ability and activate Pemmin's Aura. You activate Pemmin's Aura giving Spellskite shroud, then on the stack you redirect the spell/ability to Spellskite. Spellskite's ability resolves first and redirects the spell/ability, then Pemmin's Aura's ability resolves and gives Spellskite shroud, then the spell/ability tries to resolve but can't, and the spell/ability fizzles.

posts.post_content:
While it can be called Morphling's Aura, people are overlooking one thing this card can do that Morphling itself can't.  
  
Function as (blue, I might add) removal. Although it might be expensive to cast on an opponent's creature and reduce its toughness to zero on the same turn, using it to kill is still pretty awesome and has saved me a few times.

posts.post_content:
People keep saying the anagram is 'I am Superman', but it really is 'I'm a superman.' this way has it show the creatures utility, allows for multiple auras, and uses the apostrophe as well. Both work, but just saying ...  
  
About the aura itself, it is amazing, and can function as either aggro or combo, making this an astoundingly versatile card. whether it is using the untap to go infinite or just spam an ability or using shroud, flying and flowstone to deal damage, this card is definitely one of the best auras in existence.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
[Archivist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Archivist)  
[Solarion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Solarion)  
[Prodigal Sorcerer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Prodigal Sorcerer)  
[Azami, Lady of Scrolls](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Azami, Lady of Scrolls)  
[Arcanis the Omnipotent](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arcanis the Omnipotent)  
[Avatar of Woe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Avatar of Woe)  
[Niv-Mizzet, the Firemind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Niv-Mizzet, the Firemind)  
[Steel Overseer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Steel Overseer)  
[Lightning Grafter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Grafter)  
[Experiment Kraj](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Experiment Kraj)  
[Gelectrode](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gelectrode)  
[Marrow-Gnawer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Marrow-Gnawer)  
  
The list goes on, but all of these are fairly crazy combines with Pemmin's Aura (or [Freed from the Real](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Freed from the Real) for that matter). [Archivist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Archivist) and [Azami](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Azami) draws you a lot of cards, [Arcanis](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arcanis) draws you three times more, [Niv-Mizzet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Niv-Mizzet) draws cards and deal a lot of damage, and [Solarion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Solarion) becomes flat-out ridiculously big (and has flying).

The list goes on, but all of these are fairly crazy combines with Pemmin's Aura (or Freed from the Real for that matter).
